- [#3131](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3131): Fix `Style/ZeroLengthPredicate` to ignore `size` and `length` variables. ([@tejasbubane](https://github.com/tejasbubane))
- [#3146](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/3146): Fix `NegatedIf` and `NegatedWhile` to ignore double negations. ([@natalzia-paperless](https://github.com/natalzia-paperless))
- [#3140](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/3140): `Style/FrozenStringLiteralComment` works with file doesn't have any tokens. ([@pocke](https://github.com/pocke))
- [#3154](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3154): Fix handling of `()` in `Style/RedundantParentheses`. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- [#3155](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3155): Fix `Style/SpaceAfterNot` reporting on the `not` keyword. ([@NobodysNightmare](https://github.com/NobodysNightmare))
- [#3160](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/3160): `Style/Lambda` fix whitespacing when auto-correcting unparenthesized arguments. ([@palkan](https://github.com/palkan))
- [#2944](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2944): Don't crash on strings that span multiple lines but only have one pair of delimiters in `Style/StringLiterals`. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#3157](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3157): Don't let `LineEndConcatenation` and `UnneededInterpolation` make changes to the same string during auto-correct. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#3187](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3187): Let `Style/BlockDelimiters` ignore blocks in _all_ method arguments. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- Modify `Style/ParallelAssignment` to use implicit begins when parallel assignment uses a `rescue` modifier and is the only thing in the method. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- [#3217](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/3217): Fix output of ellipses for multi-line offense ranges in HTML formatter. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#3207](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3207): Auto-correct modifier `while`/`until` and `begin`..`end` + `while`/`until` in `Style/InfiniteLoop`. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#3202](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3202): Fix `Style/EmptyElse` registering wrong offenses and thus making RuboCop crash. ([@deivid-rodriguez](https://github.com/deivid-rodriguez))
- [#3183](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3183): Ensure `Style/SpaceInsideBlockBraces` reports offenses for multi-line blocks. ([@owst](https://github.com/owst))
- [#3017](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3017): Fix `Style/StringLiterals` to register offenses on non-ascii strings. ([@deivid-rodriguez](https://github.com/deivid-rodriguez))
- [#3056](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3056): Fix `Style/StringLiterals` to register offenses on non-ascii strings. ([@deivid-rodriguez](https://github.com/deivid-rodriguez))
- [#2986](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2986): Fix `RedundantBlockCall` to not report calls that pass block arguments, or where the block has been overridden. ([@owst](https://github.com/owst))
- [#3223](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3223): Return can take many arguments. ([@ptarjan](https://github.com/ptarjan))
- [#3239](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/3239): Fix bug with --auto-gen-config and a file that does not exist. ([@meganemura](https://github.com/meganemura))
- [#3138](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3138): Fix RuboCop crashing when config file contains utf-8 characters and external encoding is not utf-8. ([@deivid-rodriguez](https://github.com/deivid-rodriguez))
- [#3175](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/3175): Generate 'Exclude' list for the cops with configurable enforced style to `.rubocop_todo.yml` if different styles are used. ([@flexoid](https://github.com/flexoid))
- [#3231](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/3231): Make `Rails/UniqBeforePluck` more conservative. ([@tjwp](https://github.com/tjwp))

### Changes
- [#3149](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/3149): Make `Style/HashSyntax` configurable to not report hash rocket syntax for symbols ending with ? or ! when using ruby19 style. ([@owst](https://github.com/owst))
- [#1758](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1758): Let `Style/ClosingParenthesisIndentation` follow `Style/AlignParameters` configuration for method calls. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#3224](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3224): Rename `Style/DeprecatedHashMethods` to `Style/PreferredHashMethods`. ([@tejasbubane](https://github.com/tejasbubane))

name: RuboCop 0.40
body:
### New features
- [#2997](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2997): `Performance/CaseWhenSplat` can now identify multiple offenses in the same branch and offenses that do not occur as the first argument. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- [#2928](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2928): `Style/NestedParenthesizedCalls` cop can auto-correct. ([@drenmi](https://github.com/drenmi))
- `Style/RaiseArgs` cop can auto-correct. ([@drenmi](https://github.com/drenmi))
- [#2993](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2993): `Style/SpaceAfterColon` now checks optional keyword arguments. ([@owst](https://github.com/owst))
- [#3003](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/3003): Read command line options from `.rubocop` file and `RUBOCOP_OPTS` environment variable. ([@bolshakov](https://github.com/bolshakov))
- [#2857](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2857): `Style/MultilineArrayBraceLayout` enforced style is configurable and supports `symmetrical` and `new_line` options. ([@panthomakos](https://github.com/panthomakos))
- [#2857](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2857): `Style/MultilineHashBraceLayout` enforced style is configurable and supports `symmetrical` and `new_line` options. ([@panthomakos](https://github.com/panthomakos))
- [#2857](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2857): `Style/MultilineMethodCallBraceLayout` enforced style is configurable and supports `symmetrical` and `new_line` options. ([@panthomakos](https://github.com/panthomakos))
- [#2857](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2857): `Style/MultilineMethodDefinitionBraceLayout` enforced style is configurable and supports `symmetrical` and `new_line` options. ([@panthomakos](https://github.com/panthomakos))
- [#3052](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/3052): `Style/MultilineArrayBraceLayout` enforced style supports `same_line` option. ([@panthomakos](https://github.com/panthomakos))
- [#3052](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/3052): `Style/MultilineHashBraceLayout` enforced style supports `same_line` option. ([@panthomakos](https://github.com/panthomakos))
- [#3052](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/3052): `Style/MultilineMethodCallBraceLayout` enforced style supports `same_line` option. ([@panthomakos](https://github.com/panthomakos))
- [#3052](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/3052): `Style/MultilineMethodDefinitionBraceLayout` enforced style supports `same_line` option. ([@panthomakos](https://github.com/panthomakos))
- [#3019](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3019): Add new `Style/EmptyCaseCondition` cop. ([@owst](https://github.com/owst), [@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- [#3072](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/3072): Add new `Lint/UselessArraySplat` cop. ([@owst](https://github.com/owst))
- [#3022](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3022): `Style/Lambda` enforced style supports `literal` option. ([@drenmi](https://github.com/drenmi))
- [#2909](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2909): `Style/Lambda` enforced style supports `lambda` option. ([@drenmi](https://github.com/drenmi))
- [#3092](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/3092): Allow `Style/Encoding` to enforce using no encoding comments. ([@NobodysNightmare](https://github.com/NobodysNightmare))
- New cop `Rails/UniqBeforePluck` checks that `uniq` is used before `pluck`. ([@tjwp](https://github.com/tjwp))

### Bug fixes
- [#3112](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3112): Fix `Style/ClassAndModuleChildren` for nested classes with explicit superclass. ([@jspanjers](https://github.com/jspanjers))
- [#3032](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3032): Fix autocorrecting parentheses for predicate methods without space before args. ([@graemeboy](https://github.com/graemeboy))
- [#3000](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/3000): Fix encoding crash on HTML output. ([@gerrywastaken](https://github.com/gerrywastaken))
- [#2983](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2983): `Style/AlignParameters` message was clarified for `with_fixed_indentation` style. ([@dylanahsmith](https://github.com/dylanahsmith))
- [#2314](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2314): Ignore `UnusedBlockArgument` for keyword arguments. ([@volkert](https://github.com/volkert))
- [#2975](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2975): Make comment indentation before `)` consistent with comment indentation before `}` or `]`. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#3010](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3010): Fix double reporting/correction of spaces after ternary operator colons (now only reported by `Style/SpaceAroundOperators`, and not `Style/SpaceAfterColon` too). ([@owst](https://github.com/owst))
- [#3006](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3006): Register an offense for calling `merge!` on a method on a variable inside `each_with_object` in `Performance/RedundantMerge`. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet), [@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- [#2886](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2886): Custom cop changes now bust the cache. ([@ptarjan](https://github.com/ptarjan))
- [#3043](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3043): `Style/SpaceAfterNot` will now register an offense for a receiver that is wrapped in parentheses. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- [#3039](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3039): Accept `match` without a receiver in `Performance/EndWith`. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- [#3039](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3039): Accept `match` without a receiver in `Performance/StartWith`. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- [#3048](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3048): `Lint/NestedMethodDefinition` shouldn't flag methods defined on Structs. ([@owst](https://github.com/owst))
- [#2912](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2912): Check whether a line is aligned with the following line if the preceding line is not an assignment. ([@akihiro17](https://github.com/akihiro17))
- [#3036](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3036): Don't let `Lint/UnneededDisable` inspect files that are excluded for the cop. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#2874](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2874): Fix bug when the closing parenthesis is preceded by a newline in array and hash literals in `Style/RedundantParentheses`. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- [#3049](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3049): Make `Lint/UselessAccessModifier` detect conditionally defined methods and correctly handle dynamically defined methods and singleton class methods. ([@owst](https://github.com/owst))
- [#3004](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/3004): Don't add `Style/Alias` offenses for use of `alias` in `instance_eval` blocks, since object instances don't respond to `alias_method`. ([@magni-](https://github.com/magni-))
- [#3061](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/3061): Custom cops now show up in --show-cops. ([@ptarjan](https://github.com/ptarjan))
- [#3088](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/3088): Ignore offenses that involve conflicting HEREDOCs in the `Style/Multiline*BraceLayout` cops. ([@panthomakos](https://github.com/panthomakos))
- [#3083](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3083): Do not register an offense for splat block args in `Style/SymbolProc`. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- [#3063](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3063): Don't auto-correct `a + \` into `a + \\` in `Style/LineEndConcatenation`. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#3034](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3034): Report offenses for `RuntimeError.new(msg)` in `Style/RedundantException`. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#3016](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/3016): `Style/SpaceAfterComma` now uses `Style/SpaceInsideHashLiteralBraces`'s setting. ([@ptarjan](https://github.com/ptarjan))

### Changes
- [#2995](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2995): Removed deprecated path matching syntax. ([@gerrywastaken](https://github.com/gerrywastaken))
- [#3025](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/3025): Removed deprecation warnings for `rubocop-todo.yml`. ([@ptarjan](https://github.com/ptarjan))
- [#3028](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/3028): Add `define_method` to the default list of `IgnoredMethods` of `Style/SymbolProc`. ([@jastkand](https://github.com/jastkand))
- [#3064](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/3064): `Style/SpaceAfterNot` highlights the entire expression instead of just the exlamation mark. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- [#3085](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/3085): Enable `Style/MultilineArrayBraceLayout` and `Style/MultilineHashBraceLayout` with the `symmetrical` style by default. ([@panthomakos](https://github.com/panthomakos))
- [#3091](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/3091): Enable `Style/MultilineMethodCallBraceLayout` and `Style/MultilineMethodDefinitionBraceLayout` with the `symmetrical` style by default. ([@panthomakos](https://github.com/panthomakos))
- [#1830](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/1830): `Style/PredicateName` now ignores the `spec/` directory, since there is a strong convention for using `have_*` and `be_*` helper methods in RSpec. ([@gylaz](https://github.com/gylaz))

name: RuboCop 0.39
body:
### New features
- `Performance/TimesMap` cop can auto-correct. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- `Style/ZeroLengthPredicate` cop can auto-correct. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- [#2828](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2828): `Style/ConditionalAssignment` is now configurable to enforce assignment inside of conditions or to enforce assignment to conditions. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- [#2862](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2862): `Performance/Detect` and `Performance/Count` have a new configuration `SafeMode` that is defaulted to `true`. These cops have known issues with `Rails` and other ORM frameworks. With this default configuration, these cops will not run if the `Rails` cops are enabled. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- `Style/IfUnlessModifierOfIfUnless` cop added. ([@amuino](https://github.com/amuino))

### Bug fixes
- [#2948](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2948): `Style/SpaceAroundKeyword` should allow yield[n] and super[n]. ([@laurelfan](https://github.com/laurelfan))
- [#2950](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2950): Fix auto-correcting cases in which precedence has changed in `Style/OneLineConditional`. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- [#2947](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2947): Fix auto-correcting `if-then` in `Style/Next`. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- [#2904](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2904): `Style/RedundantParentheses` doesn't flag `-(1.method)` or `+(1.method)`, since removing the parentheses would change the meaning of these expressions. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2958](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2958): `Style/MultilineMethodCallIndentation` doesn't fail when inspecting unary ops which span multiple lines. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2959](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2959): `Lint/LiteralInInterpolation` doesn't report offenses for iranges and eranges with non-literal endpoints. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2960](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2960): `Lint/AssignmentInCondition` catches method assignments (like `obj.attr = val`) in a condition. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2871](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2871): Second solution for possible encoding incompatibility when outputting an HTML report. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#2967](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2967): Fix auto-correcting of `===`, `<=`, and `>=` in `Style/ConditionalAssignment`. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- [#2977](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2977): Fix auto-correcting of `"#{$!}"` in `Style/SpecialGlobalVars`. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- [#2935](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2935): Make configuration loading work if `SafeYAML.load` is private. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))

### Changes
- `require:` only does relative includes when it starts with a `.`. ([@ptarjan](https://github.com/ptarjan))
- `Style/IfUnlessModifier` does not trigger if the body is another conditional. ([@amuino](https://github.com/amuino))
- [#2963](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2963): `Performance/RedundantMerge` will now register an offense inside of `each_with_object`. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))

name: RuboCop 0.38
body:
### New features
- `Style/UnlessElse` cop can auto-correct. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- [#2629](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2629): Add a new public API method, `highlighted_area` to offense. This method returns the range of the highlighted portion of an offense. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- `Style/OneLineConditional` cop can auto-correct. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- [#2905](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2905): `Style/ZeroLengthConditional` flags code like `array.length < 1`, `1 > array.length`, and so on. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2892](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2892): `Lint/BlockAlignment` cop can be configured to be stricter. ([@ptarjan](https://github.com/ptarjan))
- `Style/Not` is able to autocorrect in cases where parentheses must be added to preserve the meaning of an expression. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Style/Not` auto-corrects comparison expressions by removing `not` and using the opposite comparison. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))

### Bug fixes
- Add `require 'time'` to `remote_config.rb` to avoid "undefined method `rfc2822'". ([@necojackarc](https://github.com/necojackarc))
- Replace `Rake::TaskManager#last_comment` with `Rake::TaskManager#last_description` for Rake 11 compatibility. ([@tbrisker](https://github.com/tbrisker))
- Fix false positive in `Style/TrailingCommaInArguments` & `Style/TrailingCommaInLiteral` cops with consistent_comma style. ([@meganemura](https://github.com/meganemura))
- [#2861](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2861): Fix false positive in `Style/SpaceAroundKeyword` for `rescue(...`. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- [#2832](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2832): `Style/MultilineOperationIndentation` treats operations inside blocks inside other operations correctly. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#2865](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2865): Change `require:` in config to be relative to the `.rubocop.yml` file itself. ([@ptarjan](https://github.com/ptarjan))
- [#2845](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2845): Handle heredocs in `Style/MultilineLiteralBraceLayout` auto-correct. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#2848](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2848): Handle comments inside arrays in `Style/MultilineArrayBraceLayout` auto-correct. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- `Style/TrivialAccessors` allows predicate methods by default. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2869](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2869): Offenses which occur in the body of a `when` clause with multiple arguments will not be missed. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Lint/UselessAccessModifier` recognizes method defs inside a `begin` block. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2870](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2870): `Lint/UselessAccessModifier` recognizes method definitions which are passed as an argument to a method call. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2859](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2859): `Style/RedundantParentheses` doesn't consider the parentheses in `(!receiver.method arg)` to be redundant, since they might change the meaning of an expression, depending on precedence. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2852](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2852): `Performance/Casecmp` doesn't flag uses of `downcase`/`upcase` which are not redundant. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2850](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2850): `Style/FileName` doesn't choke on empty files with spaces in their names. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2834](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2834): When configured as `ConsistentQuotesInMultiline: true`, `Style/StringLiterals` doesn't error out when inspecting a heredoc with differing indentation across multiple lines. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2876](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2876): `Style/ConditionalAssignment` behaves correctly when assignment statement uses a character which has a special meaning in a regex. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2877](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2877): `Style/SpaceAroundKeyword` doesn't flag `!super.method`, `!yield.method`, and so on. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2631](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2631): `Style/Encoding` can remove unneeded encoding comment when autocorrecting with `when_needed` style. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2860](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2860): Fix false positive in `Rails/Date` when `to_time` is chained with safe method. ([@palkan](https://github.com/palkan))
- [#2898](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2898): `Lint/NestedMethodDefinition` allows methods defined inside `Class.new(S)` blocks. ([@segiddins](https://github.com/segiddins))
- [#2894](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2894): Fix auto-correct an unless with a comparison operator. ([@jweir](https://github.com/jweir))
- [#2911](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2911): `Style/ClassAndModuleChildren` doesn't flag nested class definitions, where the outer class has an explicit superclass (because such definitions can't be converted to `compact` style). ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2871](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2871): Don't crash when offense messages are read back from cache with `ASCII-8BIT` encoding and output as HTML or JSON. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#2901](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2901): Don't crash when `ENV['HOME']` is undefined. ([@mikegee](https://github.com/mikegee))
- [#2627](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2627): `Style/BlockDelimiters` does not flag blocks delimited by `{}` when a block call is the final value in a hash with implicit braces (one which is the last argument to an outer method call). ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))

### Changes
- Update Rake to version 11. ([@tbrisker](https://github.com/tbrisker))
- [#2629](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2629): Change the offense range for metrics cops to default to `expression` instead of `keyword` (the offense now spans the entire method, class, or module). ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- [#2891](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2891): Change the caching of remote configs to live alongside the parent file. ([@Fryguy](https://github.com/Fryguy))
- [#2662](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2662): When setting options for Rake task, nested arrays can be used in the `options`, `formatters`, and `requires` arrays. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2925](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2925): Bump unicode-display_width dependency to >= 1.0.1. ([@jspanjers](https://github.com/jspanjers))
- [#2875](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2875): `Style/SignalException` does not flag calls to `fail` if a custom method named `fail` is defined in the same file. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2923](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2923): `Style/FileName` considers file names which contain a ? or ! character to still be "snake case". ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2879](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2879): When autocorrecting, `Lint/UnusedMethodArgument` removes unused block arguments rather than simply prefixing them with an underscore. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))

name: RuboCop 0.37.2
body:
### Bug fixes
- Fix auto-correction of array and hash literals in `Lint/LiteralInInterpolation`. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- [#2815](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2815): Fix missing assets for html formatter. ([@prsimp](https://github.com/prsimp))
- `Style/RedundantParentheses` catches offenses involving the 2nd argument to a method call without parentheses, if the 2nd argument is a hash. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Style/RedundantParentheses` catches offenses inside an array literal. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Style/RedundantParentheses` doesn't flag `method (:arg) {}`, since removing the parentheses would change the meaning of the expression. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Performance/Detect` doesn't flag code where `first` or `last` takes an argument, as it cannot be transformed to equivalent code using `detect`. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Style/SpaceAroundOperators` ignores aref assignments. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Style/RescueModifier` indents code correctly when auto-correcting. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Style/RedundantMerge` indents code correctly when auto-correcting, even if the corrected hash had multiple keys, and even if the corrected code was indented to start with. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2831](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2831): `Performance/RedundantMerge` doesn't break code by autocorrecting a `#merge!` call which occurs at tail position in a block. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))

### Changes
- Handle auto-correction of nested interpolations in `Lint/LiteralInInterpolation`. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- RuboCop results cache uses different directory names when there are many (or long) CLI options, to avoid a very long path which could cause failures on some filesystems. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))

name: RuboCop 0.37.1
body:
### New features
- [#2798](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2798): `Rails/FindEach` cop works with `where.not`. ([@pocke](https://github.com/pocke))
- `Style/MultilineBlockLayout` can correct offenses which involve argument destructuring. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Style/SpaceAroundKeyword` checks `super` nodes with no args. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Style/SpaceAroundKeyword` checks `defined?` nodes. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2719](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2719): `Style/ConditionalAssignment` handles correcting the alignment of `end`. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))

### Bug fixes
- Fix auto-correction of `not` with parentheses in `Style/Not`. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- [#2784](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2784): RuboCop can inspect `super { ... }` and `super(arg) { ... }`. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2781](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2781): `Performance/RedundantMerge` doesn't flag calls to `#update`, since many classes have methods by this name (not only `Hash`). ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2780](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2780): `Lint/DuplicateMethods` does not flag method definitions inside dynamic `Class.new` blocks. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2775](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2775): `Style/SpaceAroundKeyword` doesn't flag `yield.method`. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2774](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2774): `Style/SpaceAroundOperators` doesn't flag calls to `#[]`. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2772](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2772): RuboCop doesn't crash when `AllCops` section in configuration file is empty (rather, it displays a warning as intended). ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2737](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2737): `Style/GuardClause` handles `elsif` clauses correctly. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2735](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2735): `Style/MultilineBlockLayout` doesn't cause an infinite loop by moving `end` onto the same line as the block args. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2715](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2715): `Performance/RedundantMatch` doesn't flag calls to `#match` which take a block. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2704](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2704): `Lint/NestedMethodDefinition` doesn't flag singleton defs which define a method on the value of a local variable. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2660](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2660): `Style/TrailingUnderscoreVariable` shows recommended code in its offense message. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2671](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2671): `Style/WordArray` doesn't attempt to inspect strings with invalid encoding, to avoid failing with an encoding error. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))

### Changes
- [#2739](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2739): Change the configuration option `when_needed` in `Style/FrozenStringLiteralComment` to add a `frozen_string_literal` comment to all files when the `TargetRubyVersion` is set to 2.3+. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))

name: RuboCop 0.37
body:
### New features
- [#2620](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2620): New cop `Style/ZeroLengthPredicate` checks for `object.size == 0` and variants, and suggests replacing them with an appropriate `empty?` predicate. ([@drenmi](https://github.com/drenmi))
- [#2657](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2657): Floating headers in HTML output. ([@mattparlane](https://github.com/mattparlane))
- Add new `Style/SpaceAroundKeyword` cop. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- [#2745](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2745): New cop `Style/MultilineHashBraceLayout` checks that the closing brace in a hash literal is symmetrical with respect to the opening brace and the hash elements. ([@panthomakos](https://github.com/panthomakos))
- [#2761](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2761): New cop `Style/MultilineMethodDefinitionBraceLayout` checks that the closing brace in a method definition is symmetrical with respect to the opening brace and the method parameters. ([@panthomakos](https://github.com/panthomakos))
- [#2699](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2699): `Performance/Casecmp` can register offenses when `str.downcase` or `str.upcase` are passed to an equality method. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- [#2766](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2766): New cop `Style/MultilineMethodCallBraceLayout` checks that the closing brace in a method call is symmetrical with respect to the opening brace and the method arguments. ([@panthomakos](https://github.com/panthomakos))

### Bug fixes
- [#2723](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2723): Fix NoMethodError in Style/GuardClause. ([@drenmi](https://github.com/drenmi))
- [#2674](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2674): Also check for Hash#update alias in `Performance/RedundantMerge`. ([@drenmi](https://github.com/drenmi))
- [#2630](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2630): Take frozen string literals into account in `Style/MutableConstant`. ([@segiddins](https://github.com/segiddins))
- [#2642](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2642): Support assignment via `||=` in `Style/MutableConstant`. ([@segiddins](https://github.com/segiddins))
- [#2646](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2646): Fix auto-correcting assignment to a constant in `Style/ConditionalAssignment`. ([@segiddins](https://github.com/segiddins))
- [#2614](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2614): Check for zero return value from `casecmp` in `Performance/casecmp`. ([@segiddins](https://github.com/segiddins))
- [#2647](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2647): Allow `xstr` interpolations in `Lint/LiteralInInterpolation`. ([@segiddins](https://github.com/segiddins))
- Report a violation when `freeze` is called on a frozen string literal in `Style/RedundantFreeze`. ([@segiddins](https://github.com/segiddins))
- [#2641](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2641): Fix crashing on empty methods with block args in `Perfomance/RedundantBlockCall`. ([@segiddins](https://github.com/segiddins))
- `Lint/DuplicateMethods` doesn't crash when `class_eval` is used with an implicit receiver. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- [#2654](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2654): Fix handling of unary operations in `Style/RedundantParentheses`. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- [#2661](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2661): `Style/Next` doesn't crash when auto-correcting modifier `if/unless`. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- [#2665](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2665): Make specs pass when running on Windows. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#2691](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2691): Do not register an offense in `Performance/TimesMap` for calling `map` or `collect` on a variable named `times`. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- [#2689](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2689): Change `Performance/RedundantBlockCall` to respect parentheses usage. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- [#2694](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2694): Fix caching when using a different JSON gem such as Oj. ([@stormbreakerbg](https://github.com/stormbreakerbg))
- [#2707](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2707): Change `Lint/NestedMethodDefinition` to respect `Class.new` and `Module.new`. ([@owst](https://github.com/owst))
- [#2701](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2701): Do not consider assignments to the same variable as useless if later assignments are within a loop. ([@owst](https://github.com/owst))
- [#2696](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2696): `Style/NestedModifier` adds parentheses around a condition when needed. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- [#2666](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2666): Fix bug when auto-correcting symbol literals in `Lint/LiteralInInterpolation`. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- [#2664](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2664): `Performance/Casecmp` can auto-correct case comparison to variables and method calls without error. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- [#2729](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2729): Fix handling of hash literal as the first argument in `Style/RedundantParentheses`. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- [#2703](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2703): Handle byte order mark in `Style/IndentationWidth`, `Style/ElseAlignment`, `Lint/EndAlignment`, and `Lint/DefEndAlignment`. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#2710](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2710): Fix handling of fullwidth characters in some cops. ([@seikichi](https://github.com/seikichi))
- [#2690](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2690): Fix alignment of operands that are part of an assignment in `Style/MultilineOperationIndentation`. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#2228](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2228): Use the config of a related cop whether it's enabled or not. ([@madwort](https://github.com/madwort))
- [#2721](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2721): Do not register an offense for constants wrapped in parentheses passed to `rescue` in `Style/RedundantParentheses`. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- [#2742](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2742): Fix `Style/TrailingCommaInArguments` & `Style/TrailingCommaInLiteral` for inline single element arrays. ([@annih](https://github.com/annih))
- [#2768](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2768): Allow parentheses after keyword `not` in `Style/MethodCallParentheses`. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- [#2758](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2758): Allow leading underscores in camel case variable names.([@mmcguinn](https://github.com/mmcguinn))

### Changes
- Remove `Style/SpaceAfterControlKeyword` and `Style/SpaceBeforeModifierKeyword` as the more generic `Style/SpaceAroundKeyword` handles the same cases. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- Handle comparisons with `!=` in `Performance/casecmp`. ([@segiddins](https://github.com/segiddins))
- [#2684](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2684): Do not base `Style/FrozenStringLiteralComment` on the version of Ruby that is running. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- [#2732](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2732): Change the default style of `Style/SignalException` to `only_raise`. ([@bbatsov](https://github.com/bbatsov))

name: RuboCop 0.36.0
body:
An epic release - the one which contains the most new features and
bugfixes since the inception of the project!  A huge thanks to the
amazing contributors who helped make it a reality!

Notably, this release adds support for Ruby 2.3 and introduces the
important concept of a target Ruby version - meaning RuboCop will no
longer try to parse the code with a parser matching the interpreter
you're using, but a parser matching the target Ruby version you
specified in `.rubocop.yml`. This way you won't introduce accidentally
syntax from a newer Ruby when you want to maintain
compatibility with certain older Rubies.

Enjoy!

### New features
- [#2598](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2598): New cop `Lint/RandOne` checks for `rand(1)`, `Kernel.rand(1.0)` and similar calls. Such call are most likely a mistake because they always return `0`. ([@DNNX](https://github.com/DNNX))
- [#2590](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2590): New cop `Performance/DoubleStartEndWith` checks for two `start_with?` (or `end_with?`) calls joined by `||` with the same receiver, like `str.start_with?('x') || str.start_with?('y')` and suggests using one call instead: `str.start_with?('x', 'y')`. ([@DNNX](https://github.com/DNNX))
- [#2583](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2583): New cop `Performance/TimesMap` checks for `x.times.map{}` and suggests replacing them with `Array.new(x){}`. ([@DNNX](https://github.com/DNNX))
- [#2529](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2529): Add EnforcedStyle config parameter to IndentArray. ([@jawshooah](https://github.com/jawshooah))
- [#2479](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2479): Add option `AllowHeredoc` to `Metrics/LineLength`. ([@fphilipe](https://github.com/fphilipe))
- [#2416](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2416): New cop `Style/ConditionalAssignment` checks for assignment of the same variable in all branches of conditionals and replaces them with a single assignment to the return of the conditional. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- [#2410](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2410): New cop `Style/IndentAssignment` checks the indentation of the first line of the right-hand-side of a multi-line assignment. ([@panthomakos](https://github.com/panthomakos))
- [#2431](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2431): Add `IgnoreExecutableScripts` option to `Style/FileName`. ([@sometimesfood](https://github.com/sometimesfood))
- [#2460](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2460): New cop `Style/UnneededInterpolation` checks for strings that are just an interpolated expression. ([@cgriego](https://github.com/cgriego))
- [#2361](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2361): `Style/MultilineAssignmentLayout` cop checks for a newline after the assignment operator in a multi-line assignment. ([@panthomakos](https://github.com/panthomakos))
- [#2462](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2462): `Lint/UselessAccessModifier` can catch more types of useless access modifiers. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#1677](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1677): Add new `Performance/Casecmp` cop. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#1677](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1677): Add new `Performance/RangeInclude` cop. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#1677](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1677): Add new `Performance/RedundantSortBy` cop. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#1677](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1677): Add new `Performance/LstripRstrip` cop. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#1677](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1677): Add new `Performance/StartWith` cop. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#1677](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1677): Add new `Performance/EndWith` cop. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#1677](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1677): Add new `Performance/RedundantMerge` cop. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Lint/Debugger` cop can now auto-correct offenses. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#1677](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1677): Add new `Performance/RedundantMatch` cop. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#1677](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1677): Add new `Performance/RedundantBlockCall` cop. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#1954](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1954): `Lint/UnneededDisable` can now autocorrect. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2501](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2501): Add new `Lint/ImplicitStringConcatenation` cop. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- Add new `Style/RedundantParentheses` cop. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- [#1346](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1346): `Style/SpecialGlobalVars` can be configured to use either `use_english_names` or `use_perl_names` styles. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2426](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2426): New `Style/NestedParenthesizedCalls` cop checks for non-parenthesized method calls nested inside a parenthesized call, like `method1(method2 arg)`. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2502](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2502): The `--stdin` and `--auto-correct` CLI options can be combined, and if you do so, corrected code is printed to stdout. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Style/ConditionalAssignment` works on conditionals with a common aref assignment (like `array[index] = val`) or attribute assignment (like `self.attribute = val`). ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2476](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2476): `Style/GuardClause` catches if..else nodes with one branch which terminates the execution of the current scope. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- New `Style/IdenticalConditionalBranches` flags `if..else` and `case..when..else` constructs with an identical line at the end of each branch. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#207](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/207): Add new `Lint/FloatOutOfRange` cop which catches floating-point literals which are too large or too small for Ruby to represent. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Style/GuardClause` doesn't report offenses in places where correction would make a line too long. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Lint/DuplicateMethods` can find duplicate method definitions in many more circumstances, even across multiple files; however, it ignores definitions inside `if` or something which could be a DSL method. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- A warning is printed if an invalid `EnforcedStyle` is configured. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#1367](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1367): New `Lint/IneffectiveAccessModifier` checks for access modifiers which are erroneously applied to a singleton method, where they have no effect. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#1614](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1614): `Lint/BlockAlignment` aligns block end with splat operator when applied to a splatted method call. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2263](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2263): Warn if `task.options = %w(--format ...)` is used when configuring `RuboCop::RakeTask`; this should be `task.formatters = ...` instead. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2511](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2511): `--no-offense-counts` CLI option suppresses the inclusion of offense count lines in auto-generated config. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2504](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2504): New `AllowForAlignment` config parameter for `Style/SingleSpaceBeforeFirstArg` allows the insertion of extra spaces before the first argument if it aligns it with something on the preceding or following line. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2478](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2478): `Style/ExtraSpacing` has new `ForceEqualSignAlignment` config parameter which forces = signs on consecutive lines to be aligned, and it can auto-correct. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Lint/BlockAlignment` aligns block end with unary operators like ~, -, or ! when such operators are applied to the method call taking the block. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#1460](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1460): `Style/Alias` supports both `prefer_alias` and `prefer_alias_method` styles. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#1569](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1569): New `ExpectMatchingDefinition` config parameter for `Style/FileName` makes it check for a class or module definition in each file which corresponds to the file name and path. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2480](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2480): Add a configuration to `Style/ConditionalAssignment` to check and correct conditionals that contain multiple assignments. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- [#2480](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2480): Allow `Style/ConditionalAssignment` to correct assignment in ternary operations. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- [#2480](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2480): Allow `Style/ConditionalAssignment` to correct comparable methods. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- [#1633](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1633): New cop `Style/MultilineMethodCallIndentation` takes over the responsibility for checking alignment of methods from the `Style/MultilineOperationIndentation` cop. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#2472](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2472): New cop `Style/MultilineArrayBraceLayout` checks that the closing brace in an array literal is symmetrical with respect to the opening brace and the array elements. ([@panthomakos](https://github.com/panthomakos))
- [#1543](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1543): `Style/WordArray` has both `percent` and `brackets` (which enforces the use of bracketed arrays for strings) styles. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Style/SpaceAroundOperators` has `AllowForAlignment` config parameter which allows extra spaces on the left if they serve to align the operator with another. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Style/SymbolArray` has both `percent` and `brackets` (which enforces the user of bracketed arrays for symbols) styles. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2343](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2343): Entire cop types (or "departments") can be disabled using in .rubocop.yml using config like `Style: Enabled: false`. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2399](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2399): New `start_of_line` style for `Lint/EndAlignment` aligns a closing `end` keyword with the start of the line where the opening keyword appears. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#1545](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1545): New `Regex` config parameter for `Style/FileName` allows user to provide their own regex for validating file names. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2253](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2253): New `DefaultFormatter` config parameter can be used to set formatter from within .rubocop.yml. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2481](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2481): New `WorstOffendersFormatter` prints a list of files with offenses (and offense counts), showing the files with the most offenses first. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- New `IfInsideElse` cop catches `if..end` nodes which can be converted into an `elsif` instead, reducing the nesting level. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#1725](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1725): --color CLI option forces color output, even when not printing to a TTY. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2549](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2549): New `ConsistentQuotesInMultiline` config param for `Style/StringLiterals` forces all literals which are concatenated using \ to use the same quote style. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2560](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2560): `Style/AccessModifierIndentation`, `Style/CaseIndentation`, `Style/FirstParameterIndentation`, `Style/IndentArray`, `Style/IndentAssignment`, `Style/IndentHash`, `Style/MultilineMethodCallIndentation`, and `Style/MultilineOperationIndentation` all have a new `IndentationWidth` parameter which can be used to override the indentation width from `Style/IndentationWidth`. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- Add new `Performance/HashEachMethods` cop. ([@ojab](https://github.com/ojab))
- New cop `Style/FrozenStringLiteralComment` will check for and add the comment `# frozen_string_literal: true` to the top of files. This will help with upgrading to Ruby 3.0. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))

### Bug Fixes
- [#2594](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2594): `Style/EmptyLiteral` autocorrector respects `Style/StringLiterals:EnforcedStyle` config. ([@DNNX](https://github.com/DNNX))
- [#2411](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2411): Make local inherited configuration override configuration loaded from gems. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#2413](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2413): Allow `%Q` for dynamic strings with double quotes inside them. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#2404](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2404): `Style/Next` does not remove comments when auto-correcting. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- `Style/Next` handles auto-correction of nested offenses. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- `Style/VariableInterpolation` now detects non-numeric regex back references. ([@cgriego](https://github.com/cgriego))
- `ProgressFormatter` fully respects the `--no-color` switch. ([@savef](https://github.com/savef))
- Replace `Time.zone.current` with `Time.current` on `Rails::TimeZone` cop message. ([@volmer](https://github.com/volmer))
- [#2451](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2451): `Style/StabbyLambdaParentheses` does not treat method calls named `lambda` as lambdas. ([@domcleal](https://github.com/domcleal))
- [#2463](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2463): Allow comments before an access modifier. ([@codebeige](https://github.com/codebeige))
- [#2471](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2471): `Style/MethodName` doesn't choke on methods which are defined inside methods. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2449](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2449): `Style/StabbyLambdaParentheses` only checks lambdas in the arrow form. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- [#2456](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2456): `Lint/NestedMethodDefinition` doesn't register offenses for method definitions inside an eval block (either `instance_eval`, `class_eval`, or `module_eval`). ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2464](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2464): `Style/ParallelAssignment` understands aref and attribute assignments, and doesn't warn if they can't be correctly rearranged into a series of single assignments. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2482](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2482): `Style/AndOr` doesn't raise an exception when trying to autocorrect `!variable or ...`. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2446](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2446): `Style/Tab` doesn't register errors for leading tabs which occur inside a string literal (including heredoc). ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2452](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2452): `Style/TrailingComma` incorrectly categorizes single-line hashes in methods calls. ([@panthomakos](https://github.com/panthomakos))
- [#2441](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2441): `Style/AlignParameters` doesn't crash if it finds nested offenses. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2436](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2436): `Style/SpaceInsideHashLiteralBraces` doesn't mangle a hash literal which is not surrounded by curly braces, but has another hash literal which does as its first key. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2483](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2483): `Style/Attr` differentiate between attr_accessor and attr_reader. ([@weh](https://github.com/weh))
- `Style/ConditionalAssignment` doesn't crash if it finds a `case` with an empty branch. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- [#2506](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2506): `Lint/FormatParameterMismatch` understands %{} and %<> interpolations. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2145](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2145): `Lint/ParenthesesAsGroupedExpression` ignores calls with multiple arguments, since they are not ambiguous. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2484](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2484): Remove two vulnerabilities in cache handling. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#2517](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2517): `Lint/UselessAccessModifier` doesn't think that an access modifier applied to `attr_writer` is useless. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2518](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2518): `Style/ConditionalAssignment` doesn't think that branches using `<<` and `[]=` should be combined. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `CharacterLiteral` auto-corrector now properly corrects `?'`. ([@bfontaine](https://github.com/bfontaine))
- [#2313](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2313): `Rails/FindEach` doesn't break code which uses `order(...).each`, `limit(...).each`, and so on. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#1938](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1938): `Rails/FindBy` doesn't autocorrect `where(...).first` to `find_by`, since the returned record is often different. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#1801](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1801): `EmacsFormatter` strips newlines out of error messages, if there are any. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2534](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2534): `Style/RescueEnsureAlignment` works on `rescue` nested inside a `class` or `module` block. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Lint/BlockAlignment` does not refer to a block terminator as `end` when it is actually `}`. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2540](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2540): `Lint/FormatParameterMismatch` understands format specifiers with multiple flags. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2538](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2538): `Style/SpaceAroundOperators` doesn't eat newlines. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2531](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2531): `Style/AndOr` autocorrects in cases where parentheses must be added, even inside a nested begin node. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2450](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2450): `Style/Next` adjusts indentation when auto-correcting, to avoid introducing new offenses. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2066](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2066): `Style/TrivialAccessors` doesn't flag what appear to be trivial accessor method definitions, if they are nested inside a call to `instance_eval`. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Style/SymbolArray` doesn't flag arrays of symbols if a symbol contains a space character. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Style/SymbolArray` can auto-correct offenses. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2546](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2546): Report when two `rubocop:disable` comments (not the single line kind) for a given cop apppear in a file with no `rubocop:enable` in between. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#2552](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2552): `Style/Encoding` can auto-correct files with a blank first line. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2556](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2556): `Style/SpecialGlobalVariables` generates auto-config correctly. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2565](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2565): Let `Style/SpaceAroundOperators` leave spacing around `=>` to `Style/AlignHash`. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#2569](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2569): `Style/MethodCallParentheses` doesn't register warnings for `object.()` syntax, since it is handled by `Style/LambdaCall`. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2570](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2570): `Performance/RedundantMerge` doesn't break code with a modifier `if` when autocorrecting. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Performance/RedundantMerge` doesn't break code with a modifier `while` or `until` when autocorrecting. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2574](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2574): `variable` style for `Lint/EndAlignment` is working again. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Lint/EndAlignment` can autocorrect offenses on the RHS of an assignment to an instance variable, class variable, constant, and so on; previously, it only worked if the LHS was a local variable. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2580](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2580): `Style/StringReplacement` doesn't break code when autocorrection involves a regex with embedded escapes (like /\n/). ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2582](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2582): `Style/AlignHash` doesn't move a key so far left that it goes onto the previous line (in an attempt to align). ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2588](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2588): `Style/SymbolProc` doesn't break code when autocorrecting a method call with a trailing comma in the argument list. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2448](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2448): `Style/TrailingCommaInArguments` and `Style/TrailingCommaInLiteral` don't special-case single-item lists in a way which contradicts the documentation. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- Fix for remote config files to only load from on http and https URLs. ([@ptrippett](https://github.com/ptrippett))
- [#2604](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2604): `Style/FileName` doesn't fail on empty files when `ExpectMatchingDefinition` is true. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Style/RedundantFreeze` registers offences for frozen dynamic symbols. ([@segiddins](https://github.com/segiddins))
- [#2609](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2609): All cops which rely on the `AutocorrectUnlessChangingAST` module can now autocorrect files which contain `__FILE__`. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2608](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2608): `Style/ConditionalAssignment` can autocorrect `=~` within a ternary expression. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))

### Changes
- [#2427](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2427): Allow non-snake-case file names (e.g. `some-random-script`) for Ruby scripts that have a shebang. ([@sometimesfood](https://github.com/sometimesfood))
- [#2430](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2430): `Lint/UnneededDisable` now adds "unknown cop" to messages if cop names in `rubocop:disable` comments are unrecognized, or "did you mean ..." if they are misspelled names of existing cops. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#947](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/947): `Style/Documentation` considers classes and modules which only define constants to be "namespaces", and doesn't flag them for lack of a documentation comment. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2467](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2467): Explicitly inheriting configuration from the rubocop gem in .rubocop.yml is not allowed. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2322](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2322): Output of --auto-gen-config shows content of default config parameters which are Arrays; this is especially useful for SupportedStyles. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#1566](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1566): When autocorrecting on Windows, line endings are not converted to "\r\n" in untouched portions of the source files; corrected portions may use "\n" rather than "\r\n". ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- New `rake repl` task can be used for experimentation when working on RuboCop. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Lint/SpaceBeforeFirstArg` cop has been removed, since it just duplicates `Style/SingleSpaceBeforeFirstArg`. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Style/SingleSpaceBeforeFirstArg` cop has been renamed to `Style/SpaceBeforeFirstArg`, which more accurately reflects what it now does. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Style/UnneededPercentQ` reports `%q()` strings with what only appears to be an escape, but is not really (there are no escapes in `%q()` strings). ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Performance/StringReplacement`, `Performance\StartWith`, and `Performance\EndWith` more accurately identify code which can be improved. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- The `MultiSpaceAllowedForOperators` config parameter for `Style/SpaceAroundOperators` has been removed, as it is made redundant by `AllowForAlignment`. If someone attempts to use it, config validation will fail with a helpful message. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- The `RunRailsCops` config parameter in .rubocop.yml is now obsolete. If someone attempts to use it, config validation will fail with a helpful message. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- If .rubocop.yml contains configuration for a custom cop, no warning regarding "unknown cop" will be printed. The custom cop must inherit from RuboCop::Cop::Cop, and must be loaded into memory for this to work. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2102](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2102): If .rubocop.yml exists in the working directory when running --auto-gen-config, any `Exclude` config parameters in .rubocop.yml will be merged into the generated .rubocop_todo.yml. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#1895](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1895): Remove `Rails/DefaultScope` cop. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2550](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2550): New `TargetRubyVersion` configuration parameter can be used to specify which version of the Ruby interpreter the inspected code is intended to run on. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2557](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2557): `Style/GuardClause` does not warn about `if` nodes whose condition spans multiple lines. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Style/EmptyLinesAroundClassBody`, `Style/EmptyLinesAroundModuleBody`, and `Style/EmptyLinesAroundBlockBody` accept an empty body with no blank line, even if configured to `empty_lines` style. This is because the empty lines only serve to provide a break between the header, body, and footer, and are redundant if there is no body. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2554](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2554): `Style/FirstMethodArgumentLineBreak` handles implicit hash arguments without braces; `Style/FirstHashElementLineBreak` still handles those with braces. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Style/TrailingComma` has been split into `Style/TrailingCommaInArguments` and `Style/TrailingCommaInLiteral`. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- RuboCop returns process exit code 2 if it fails due to bad configuration, bad CLI options, or an internal error. If it runs successfully but finds one or more offenses, it still exits with code 1, as was previously the case. This is helpful when invoking RuboCop programmatically, perhaps from a script. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))

name: RuboCop 0.35.0
body:
Special thanks to [Alex Dowad](https://github.com/alexdowad) who
contributed an amazing number of bug fixes and improvements for this
release! Much appreciated!

And happy birthday to my beloved granny Vasilka, who turns today 78 years!
This release is dedicated to her!

### New features
- [#2028](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2028): New config `ExtraDetails` supports addition of `Details` param to all cops to allow extra details on offense to be displayed. ([@tansaku](https://github.com/tansaku))
- [#2036](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2036): New cop `Style/StabbyLambdaParentheses` will find and correct cases where a stabby lambda's paramaters are not wrapped in parentheses. ([@hmadison](https://github.com/hmadison))
- [#2246](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2246): `Style/TrailingUnderscoreVariable` will now register an offense for `*_`. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- [#2246](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2246): `Style/TrailingUnderscoreVariable` now has a configuration to remove named underscore variables (Defaulted to false). ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- [#2276](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2276): New cop `Performance/FixedSize` will register an offense when calling `length`, `size`, or `count` on statically sized objected (strings, symbols, arrays, and hashes). ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- New cop `Style/NestedModifier` checks for nested `if`, `unless`, `while` and `until` modifier statements. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- [#2270](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2270): Add a new `inherit_gem` configuration to inherit a config file from an installed gem [(originally requested in #290)](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/290). ([@jhansche](https://github.com/jhansche))
- Allow `StyleGuide` parameters in local configuration for all cops, so users can add references to custom style guide documents. ([@cornelius](https://github.com/cornelius))
- `UnusedMethodArgument` cop allows configuration to skip keyword arguments. ([@apiology](https://github.com/apiology))
- [#2318](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2318): `Lint/Debugger` cop now checks for `Pry.rescue`. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- [#2277](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2277): New cop `Style/FirstArrayElementLineBreak` checks for a line break before the first element in a multi-line array. ([@panthomakos](https://github.com/panthomakos))
- [#2277](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2277): New cop `Style/FirstHashElementLineBreak` checks for a line break before the first element in a multi-line hash. ([@panthomakos](https://github.com/panthomakos))
- [#2277](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2277): New cop `Style/FirstMethodArgumentLineBreak` checks for a line break before the first argument in a multi-line method call. ([@panthomakos](https://github.com/panthomakos))
- [#2277](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2277): New cop `Style/FirstMethodParameterLineBreak` checks for a line break before the first parameter in a multi-line method parameter definition. ([@panthomakos](https://github.com/panthomakos))
- Add `Rails/PluralizationGrammar` cop, checks for incorrect grammar when using methods like `3.day.ago`, when you should write `3.days.ago`. ([@maxjacobson](https://github.com/maxjacobson))
- [#2347](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2347): `Lint/Eval` cop does not warn about "security risk" when eval argument is a string literal without interpolations. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2335](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2335): `Style/VariableName` cop checks naming style of method parameters. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2329](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2329): New style `braces_for_chaining` for `Style/BlockDelimiters` cop enforces braces on a multi-line block if its return value is being chained with another method. ([@panthomakos](https://github.com/panthomakos))
- `Lint/LiteralInCondition` warns if a symbol or dynamic symbol is used as a condition. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2369](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2369): `Style/TrailingComma` doesn't add a trailing comma to a multiline method chain which is the only arg to a method call. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `CircularArgumentReference` cop updated to lint for ordinal circular argument references on top of optional keyword arguments. ([@maxjacobson](https://github.com/maxjacobson))
- Added ability to download shared rubocop config files from remote urls. ([@ptrippett](https://github.com/ptrippett))
- [#1601](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1601): Add `IgnoreEmptyMethods` config parameter for `Lint/UnusedMethodArgument` and `IgnoreEmptyBlocks` config parameter for `Lint/UnusedBlockArgument` cops. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#1729](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1729): `Style/MethodDefParentheses` supports new 'require_no_parentheses_except_multiline' style. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2173](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2173): `Style/AlignParameters` also checks parameter alignment for method definitions. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#1825](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1825): New `NameWhitelist` configuration parameter for `Style/PredicateName` can be used to suppress errors on known-good predicate names. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Style/Documentation` recognizes 'Constant = Class.new' as a class definition. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#1608](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1608): Add new 'align_braces' style for `Style/IndentHash`. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Style/Next` can autocorrect. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))

### Bug Fixes
- [#2265](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2265): Handle unary `+` in `ExtraSpacing` cop. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#2275](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2275): Copy default `Exclude` into `Exclude` lists in `.rubocop_todo.yml`. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- `Style/IfUnlessModifier` accepts blocks followed by a chained call. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- [#2261](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2261): Make relative `Exclude` paths in `$HOME/.rubocop_todo.yml` be relative to current directory. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#2286](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2286): Handle auto-correction of empty method when `AllowIfMethodIsEmpty` is `false` in `Style/SingleLineMethods`. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#2246](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2246): Do not register an offense for `Style/TrailingUnderscoreVariable` when the underscore variable is preceeded by a splat variable. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- [#2292](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2292): Results should not be stored in the cache if affected by errors (crashes). ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#2280](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2280): Avoid reporting space between hash literal keys and values in `Style/ExtraSpacing`. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#2284](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2284): Fix result cache being shared between ruby versions. ([@miquella](https://github.com/miquella))
- [#2285](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2285): Fix `ConfigurableNaming#class_emitter_method?` error when handling singleton class methods. ([@palkan](https://github.com/palkan))
- [#2295](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2295): Fix Performance/Detect autocorrect to handle rogue newlines. ([@palkan](https://github.com/palkan))
- [#2294](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2294): Do not register an offense in `Performance/StringReplacement` for regex with options. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- Fix `Style/UnneededPercentQ` condition for single-quoted literal containing interpolation-like string. ([@eagletmt](https://github.com/eagletmt))
- [#2324](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2324): Handle `--only Lint/Syntax` and `--except Lint/Syntax` correctly. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#2317](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2317): Handle `case` as an argument correctly in `Lint/EndAlignment`. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- [#2287](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2287): Fix auto-correct of lines with only whitespace in `Style/IndentationWidth`. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- [#2331](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2331): Do not register an offense in `Performance/Size` for `count` with an argument. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- Handle a backslash at the end of a line in `Style/SpaceAroundOperators`. ([@lumeet](https://github.com/lumeet))
- Don't warn about lack of "leading space" in a =begin/=end comment. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2307](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2307): In `Lint/FormatParameterMismatch`, don't register an offense if either argument to % is not a literal. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2356](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2356): `Style/Encoding` will now place the encoding comment on the second line if the first line is a shebang. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- `Style/InitialIndentation` cop doesn't error out when a line begins with an integer literal. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2296](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2296): In `Style/DotPosition`, don't "correct" (and break) a method call which has a line comment (or blank line) between the dot and the selector. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2272](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2272): `Lint/NonLocalExitFromIterator` does not warn about `return` in a block which is passed to `Module#define_method`. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2262](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2262): Replace `Rainbow` reference with `Colorizable#yellow`. ([@minustehbare](https://github.com/minustehbare))
- [#2068](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2068): Display warning if `Style/Copyright` is misconfigured. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2321](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2321): In `Style/EachWithObject`, don't replace reduce with each_with_object if the accumulator parameter is assigned to in the block. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#1981](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/1981): `Lint/UselessAssignment` doesn't erroneously identify assignments in identical if branches as useless. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2323](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2323): `Style/IfUnlessModifier` cop parenthesizes autocorrected code when necessary due to operator precedence, to avoid changing its meaning. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2003](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2003): Make `Lint/UnneededDisable` work with `--auto-correct`. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- Default RuboCop cache dir moved to per-user folders. ([@br3nda](https://github.com/br3nda))
- [#2393](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2393): `Style/MethodCallParentheses` doesn't fail on `obj.method ||= func()`. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- [#2344](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2344): When autocorrecting, `Style/ParallelAssignment` reorders assignment statements, if necessary, to avoid breaking code. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))
- `Style/MultilineOperationAlignment` does not try to align the receiver and selector of a method call if both are on the LHS of an assignment. ([@alexdowad](https://github.com/alexdowad))

### Changes
- [#2194](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2194): Allow any options with `--auto-gen-config`. ([@agrimm](https://github.com/agrimm))

name: RuboCop 0.34.2
body:
### Bug Fixes
- [#2232](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2232): Fix false positive in `Lint/FormatParameterMismatch` for argument with splat operator. ([@dreyks](https://github.com/dreyks))
- [#2237](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2237): Allow `Lint/FormatParameterMismatch` to be called using `Kernel.format` and `Kernel.sprintf`. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- [#2234](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2234): Do not register an offense for `Lint/FormatParameterMismatch` when the format string is a variable. ([@rrosenblum](https://github.com/rrosenblum))
- [#2240](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/pull/2240): `Lint/UnneededDisable` should not report non-`Lint` `rubocop:disable` comments when running `rubocop --lint`. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
- [#2121](https://github.com/bbatsov/rubocop/issues/2121): Allow space before values in hash literals in `Style/ExtraSpacing` to avoid correction conflict. ([@jonas054](https://github.com/jonas054))
